"releasing energy in the form of work". In thermodynamics, work is defined as
the energy moving from the system (the internal region) to the surroundings (the
external region) during a given process. An exergonic process is one in which
there is a positive flow of energy from the system to the surroundings. This is
in contrast with an endergonic process.
